messages.message: (maybe we should create a channel for matts feedback :wink:

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Hi @Matt :wave: I'm going to present this in the GTM meeting this week but we have a process for communicating feedback from the field to product/eng: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R8h-yjSzk-z97X6-14UDqi62CmcKDGoxuI5DCYZBBB4/edit?usp=sharing

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: We've just rolled this out so input on the process is welcomed so we can improve it

This is great! One initial feedback is imagine i’m random person X. Who has no idea where the feedback belongs. Is there a general place where a product manager or someone will pick it up and route it accordingly?

There are some great tools out there, https://featureupvote.com/

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: This kind of looks like the Stack Overflow-esque feature in confluence

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.message: That is awesome! Didn’t know about it!

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Hmm maybe we should think about using that feature for feedback...let's talk about that tmrw!

Yeah I really want a way for the Sales/customer facing/usability requests to have a very easy way to provide feedback and make sure its seen. Confkunce always felt like a documentation system and a place for ideas to get lost when transferring ownership
Also this which just got a ton of funding and tons of customers”
